metadata.Title: CVE-2015-2776 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low.
metadata.Description:
The parse_SST function in FreeXL before 1.0.0i allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (memory consumption) via a crafted shared strings table in a workbook.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-2776` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libfreexl1 - 1.0.0g-1ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: freexl package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.0.0g-1ubuntu0.14.04.1').
